title.narrative: MULTIDIMENSIONAL CHILD POVERTY, RESEARCH

description.narrative: By 2020, quality research, analyses and evaluation on multiple dimensions of child poverty and deprivations inform policies and strategies for inclusive and equitable development, which contributes to Building Capacity For Evaluation, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation, Reducing Child Poverty, Research, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: All children benefit from evidence based social and economic policies that address multi-dimensional poverty and advance the equitable realization of their rights

participating-org.narrative: DIRECCAO NACIONAL DE POLITICAS ECONOMICA E DESENVOLVIMENTO MEF
UEM FACU LETRAS E CIENCIAS SOCIAIS

sector.narrative: Building evaluation capacity in UNICEF and the UN system
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
Data analysis, including situation analysis and update
Field Monitoring including humanitarian performance monitoring
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Technical assistance - Child poverty, Public Finance and Local Governance

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, quality research, analyses and evaluation on multiple dimensions of child poverty and deprivations inform policies andstrategies for inclusive and equitable development

description.narrative: Generation of quality research and evidence with a wide engagement of stakeholders at national, subnational and international levels to promote policy dialogue on children is the main achievement in 2021. Specifically, this includes: (1) Situation Analysis of Children in Mozambique and its consultation process;;(2) National Forum on Children – a three-day online conference with participation of national and international experts;;(3) Child Atlas – the Institute of National Statistics&39;;publication with disaggregated Census 2017 data , (4) interactive data mapping of the Census data in collaboration with Ministry of Economy and Finance;;and (5) Longitudinal Assessment of School Dropout.;; | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2021
